website_summaries.verdict: This monocular lacks a bunch of bells and whistles, but the price is great, and this unit is considerably better than you might expect.
pros: Easy to use and light on the wallet
Well-built and tough with effective infrared lighting
cons: Magnification not as strong as many competitors

customer_reviews.title: Much better than I expected. Impressed
customer_reviews.text: For the low price of this product this is an exceptional gen 1 NVD. Had a half moon and I could easily see out on my back farm 400 yards and identify coyotes and deer. I paired it with a Streamlight XTAC IR floodlight flashlight and this NVD became even more impressive and crisp. Picture is out the front of the house with very little ambient light and no IR. Much clearer in person than the photo form my LG phone looking down the tube. That house is 150 yards away.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Q

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I could probably go on for quite some time, but this thing simply doesn't work. Out of the box, the image was VERY blurred and it couldn't be focused for clarity. Then, it can't be turned off, and if you don't know that and leave it laying down without the dust cover, it burns a nice white spot in the display the first time the sun comes up. I should have returned it the first night, but for some reason, decided it was my fault not putting on the front lens cover.
customer_reviews.author: Earl D Walker

customer_reviews.title: Two focus methods
customer_reviews.text: It's the first night vision unit that I've owned and it works as described. You have to remember that it has two focus methods; the end one for general clarity and eye one for fine tuning. Once you master this it's amazing. The infra-red light is equally incredible. Well worth the price. DCR
customer_reviews.author: DCR

customer_reviews.title: My first impression of this Firefield is quite good.. I tried it in about a 25 ...
customer_reviews.text: i have owned a few night vision monoculars in my security business and have always stayed with the mid to lower range products because of the abuse they endure in the field. My first impression of this Firefield is quite good.. I tried it in about a 25 acre field and I was amazed at the clarity and range. I can really appreciate the 5 Power. How it with stands my abuse has not been proven,but I do recommend this lower end product right now.
customer_reviews.author: CSI PI

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: You can see in the dark! But it's kinda like looking through a Fisher Price my first night vision. The image is hazy around the edges but the center of the image is clearing. The ir light leaves something to be desired. If you use this in conjunction with a real ir flashlight it rocks.
customer_reviews.author: D. Wellisch

customer_reviews.title: They work well for the price. Fun for the kids of all ages.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these for xmas presents. One was focused right out of the box, and I had difficulty focusing the second one. There are two positions to focus, one at each end. The eyepiece for fine tuning, the end piece for rough focusing. We love looking at the stars and the beach areas at night when in total darkness. With all the hype about keeping the beaches dark for the sea turtles, it's gets pretty dark and these come in handy for just checking things out.
customer_reviews.author: Mike64

customer_reviews.title: After reading some reviews, it's obvious most haven't figured out there is more than 1 focus knob
customer_reviews.text: I was a little skeptical after reading some reviews, but then noticed that several people haven't figured out how to use it, so I took the plunge. Glad I did. I would be shocked if you could find better value. Absolutely fantastic for the price. I could clearly see objects over a hundred yards away. Very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: S. Watkins

customer_reviews.title: it is gen 1
customer_reviews.text: as expected for gen1 night vision,its worth what it cost,image is clear and mine is without alot of those black spots as ive experienced before with gen1 scopes,infrared is lacking so i purchased an infrared light to accommodate it,does have just 2 buttons which i like,on-off and ir on-off,if there's any moonlight i don't really need ir illuminated,it does intensify very well,bought it just to get to my tree stand at 5:30 am to avoid the bears and coyotes ,overall i cant complain for the price UPDATE:sent it back for refund and ordered a different brand,after 10 min using it i couldn't get it to focus,just remained blurry after trying every way to focus,finally gave up frustrated
customer_reviews.author: tipoblanco

customer_reviews.title: These work perfectly for my use
customer_reviews.text: I use these mainly to watch wildlife. This is my third set of gen one nightvision over a 20 year span and all of the ones I owned worked perfectly for my intended use. All have been very similar in light amplification and image quality. All have had a fairly narrow field of view, You need to focus the front lens first then the rear and if you use an external IP flashlight you can extend the range greatly. None of the gen 1 night vision is going to give you a perfect picture but you can definitely spot a deer, coyotes, people, etc with them. The field I typically spot in is 600 feet deep and these work great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: If I had only read the directions beforehand...naturally, I didn’t and thought the night vision device was trash. There’s a focus piece where you look into, not just at the end of the device.. Seems as if I was trash...Anywho, the device is awesome for the price. We love it. It works without batteries which is a great fail-safe. Having this 1st gen tech is a great and affordable tool to keep my family safe. Haven’t looked yet but If Firefield makes a newer gen device at a reasonable price, i’ll def buy it.
customer_reviews.author: jake

customer_reviews.title: Excellent In Every Way!
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome little device! I am so satisfied with this purchase. I’ve been wanting a NV device for years but didn’t want to pay the big bucks. I was skeptical about purchasing this at first but ended up ordering because of the reviews, and I AM NOT disappointed. This exceeds my expectations and I would recommend this to anyone reading this review looking for a reason to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Mine was absolutely worthless
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I just got a defective one. The on/off button turned on. It didn't turn off. The image was just a green blur. Could barely make out anything, this was tested outside and in a completely dark laundry room at night. Had my adult son also test it. So.............. maybe others work but mine is going back and I won't be buying another of this brand. Sorry but that is my experience.
customer_reviews.author: don north

customer_reviews.title: Get what you pay for, but what you get is worth more than the price
customer_reviews.text: Don't expect Seal Team Six or movie type night vision. It is great for the price. The optics are just ok. I tested it in a pitch black closet and could read with the IR. I bought an IR flashlight and wow, it lit up the whole closet. Didn't need the IR with the unit. For spotting things in the dark I like it. If you want the real deal, you need to pay a real price. But for most people, this will be just fine. Worth the price and performs well. If the optics were a bit more clear, it would be killer, but that would cost more. So all in, it's pretty good. Arrived quickly and well packaged.
customer_reviews.author: Sonoguy

customer_reviews.title: Cheap NV
customer_reviews.text: I honestly rather use a flashlight but if you had to this could be used to see in complete darkness. Its decent at being able to see at night but image is rather poor. Also seems to see objects further than your eyes. Best range to see clearly is about 30 yards and in. You can see further to a max of about 100 yards but thats pushing what you can see clearly. Over all i wouldnt recommend.
customer_reviews.author: The Two J's

customer_reviews.title: Can’t beat the price an quality of vision is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I use this to detect cats an animals pooping in my yard. The night vision on this item is great. When I was in the military I. The early 2003 this is very comparable to those except millitry nvg’s do not magnify. If I had a complaint I would say they could have been made a little more tougher as for as the frame. But I’m very happy with this item
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: okay..?
customer_reviews.text: honestly didn’t know whether to give it 3 or 4 stars. it’s the most basic night vision. it does what it’s supposed to do. it isn’t the clearest thing ever. but you can see “okay” to about 50yds with a full moon. no moon it’s just black & green fuzz. it does have an illuminator but it’s not “bright” enough. the 2x function seems about right but wish i found one in a 1x. the etching on the glass ain’t too bad either. it’s a decent night vision. but save your money. honestly just save yourself some money buy yourself a really good pair of nvgs!
customer_reviews.author: s

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price.  Good for viewing critters at night.
customer_reviews.text: EDITED: (changed from 3 to 4 stars because I realized the rear lense adjusts, making it much clearer. I guess because it was new it took a little more exertion on my part to get it turning the first time.) I did not expect much considering the price. It doesn't feel cheaply made. It does amplify light. The IR light works. The field of vision is smaller than I expected, but useable, especially from a tripod. The instructions are vague. The unit takes a while to power down after pressing the power button. I've used AN/PVS-7s regularly, so I try not to be too critical.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Better than Expected.
customer_reviews.text: First night vision equipment I have owned, so can't compare with any other. Would have preferred a later technology, but price considerations rule out those. Thought I would try this model. Have to say I am surprised and pleased, night vision much better than I expected. The infared really makes a difference when not much ambient light is available. Two rings to focus, generally I use the front one to get the sharpest image, then the rear adjustment to focus. Again, these are the first I have ever owned, but I consider them well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: SL60

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Better than I had expected from some of the reviews. I wanted an inexpensive option that didn’t require an IR source and these delivered. I’ll probably never know what a gem 2 or 3 looks like to compare it to, but I have a dark fence line on my property that is totally blacked out to the naked eye and these let me see the entire thing. If I turn on the IR illuminator, it’s like turning on a spotlight. Anyway, if you’re looking for a really budget NV, give it a try. You do have to constantly refocus at different ranges, but who cares, it’s awesome.
customer_reviews.author: London

customer_reviews.title: It's full of stars!
customer_reviews.text: Looking at the stars thru this you literally see billions of stars between the ones you see with your eye. I bought a "used-very good" pair and it seems they were returned because the focus adjustment by the eye took a lot of force to break free to focus. After it was free, it turned with ease. I think most people don't realize there's a rough adjustment on the end and fine adjustment on the eye piece. Can't beat the price and everyone in the family thinks they are cool, so I'm sure yours will, too.
customer_reviews.author: CoMa

customer_reviews.title: Learn the device before using, it helpsl
customer_reviews.text: U need to focus it on both ends...i skipped the instructions, inserted batteries and thought i bought a piece if Sh*t...after focusing the outside end...picture was horrible and blurry no matter how u adjusted it Came inside, read the instructions and learned the the eye piece focuses also and has trouble figuring out which piece turned for it was tight and didnt want to break it... Went outside, played with it and still wouldnt focus...then out of no where, it worked and my mind was blown and at the clarity and magnification... I rarely write reviews even on junk but writing this to those who have trouble at first like i did.. Photo taken in complete darkness
customer_reviews.author: gabriel padilla

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I have never used night vision before. It did not take long to get used to it. There is a little hole in the cap on front that will allow some light to go through so it can be tested with the lights on. Just make sure to keep the cover on when going into light. Works well under very low light and darkness.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: FOV is Horrible
customer_reviews.text: While the nightvision features are pretty decent, the field of view is horrible. Think of being on the 15th floor of a building at the beach, looking out on your deck. You have great zoom, but the field of view is horrible. You can spot a trashcan on the beach, but the trashcan takes up your entire field of view, you can't see anything around it. It makes it very difficult to spot things or use. I would not recommend this to anyone. I have other night vision monoscopes that range between 2x and 5x zoom that have a much better field of view.
customer_reviews.author: Void

customer_reviews.title: Spend the money on something better
customer_reviews.text: I guess you do get what you pay for. Quality of this was poor at best. Nothing was really in focus, even when trying to focus the lense. When you turn on the IR light, it washes out the field of view.
customer_reviews.author: R Click

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for the $$$
customer_reviews.text: Tested in my bathroom during the day right when I got it. After using both lenses to focus I was able to get a perfect clear image. You need to focus each time you look at something at a different distance to get great quality. I can't wait to test it tonight when it is pitch dark. If the quality is any different than my darkroom test I will update my review but if it works great I will leave at a five-star.
customer_reviews.author: corey

customer_reviews.title: Good Unit
customer_reviews.text: This product serves me well for spotting those pesky, nocturnal critters invading my yard. I like that you can use it while you have some light in the area without powering it up. Being in suburbia, there's always a street light not far. Powered up, it works really well in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works SO well
customer_reviews.text: Waaay more awesome than i thought It was going to be.. bought this monocular for my dad for Christmas so he can watch the animals in the bordering woods for fun at night. We can easily see 100 meters in pitch dark night. Paired with a stronger IR flashlight (that I also bought), you can easily see 400+ meters in pitch dark. You can see so well you’d think the sun was out.. it’s crazy. Worth the price for someone who enjoys the outdoors
customer_reviews.author: steven

customer_reviews.title: Blurry sight picture
customer_reviews.text: Tested it out the night it delivered and had some issues with the sight picture being blurry. I adjusted the lense and couldn’t get it to clear up much. Took it out into a bigger field to see if objects further away would be more clear and it’s all just blobs. No clarity what so ever.
customer_reviews.author: David B.

customer_reviews.title: Real surprised this actually works.
customer_reviews.text: It works well for the application I am using it for. I use it for scouting wild life and camping. I was surprised how well this thing really works. Took a bit to get the focus dialed in but after that it has been working like a champ. Not the latest gen night vision but my needs it works perfect
customer_reviews.author: Mixted

customer_reviews.title: Good Gen 1 Monocular
customer_reviews.text: Nice Gen 1 night vision monocular for the money. Saw some negative reviews about the focusing of this device and thought mine had the same issue as I couldn’t get it to focus at first. When I twisted the objective lens and the eyepiece, it actually started unscrewing the whole lens apparatus. Turns out that the focusers were so torqued down from the factory and I just had to break those seals on both the eyepiece and objective lens. Once I did that, the focusing worked great. IR works well out to about 25 yards or so. For the money, very happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: It's old school and low tech. Good for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is about as effective as the NV I used in the military thirty years ago. Nothing like the stuff hitting the market recently. Still, it's a good product at a great price. If you are willing the sacrifice a bit of quality for a lot of savings, I'd recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Byung-chul Harris

customer_reviews.title: This works extremely well for a gen 1
customer_reviews.text: First I would like to point out the delivery for this item for me was early which is always nice. Second I bought it as a Christmas gift (no relevance just as context) and opened it up and tested it to make sure it works. Not only does it work I had a clear view, with about as much detail as you’re going to get at night, it is vary easy to use. I was a little worried about some of 1 star reviews, but after taking a chance with this monocular I can’t help but feel like the people who had bad experiences were not taking care of theirs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like looking through the bottom of a fish bowl.
customer_reviews.text: I had great expectations before I bought this item. I thought I was going to see a clear image in the dark of night. But that wasn't the case. It was like looking through bottom of a fish bowl. It gets murky. Some images were very difficult to see in the dark of night even with IR button activated. However the images get quite clear if you're near a street lamp. But this scope did not work like I thought it would in the dark of night. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Eddie L.

customer_reviews.title: Does not work at all. Buy its brother the Spartan.
customer_reviews.text: This is a piece of junk. Unfortunately I waited one day past the return date and I'm stuck with it. I bought the Spartan and the Nightfall at the same time and the Spartan that costs almost double and takes a CR123 battery is outstanding. They should discontinue the Nightfall. I'll try to contact the manufacturer now.
customer_reviews.author: Arb

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: This product works much better than I expected. The image quality is superior to other similar products. Very bright imaging. The product comes with one lens cap for the main lens. I just wish that it would have came with the other remaining lens caps as well as a better quality travel bag with more adequate protective padding. Good value!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn’t be happier with how great they work!! And the picture is much clearer and obviously much stabler than in the video. This is how clear they are through the phone camera. Which is still pretty incredible! 🤙🏻💥
customer_reviews.author: RahPlace

customer_reviews.title: Great piece for the price!
customer_reviews.text: My unit had very clear lenses with no blemishes. Works great. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: JymmyTheSaint

customer_reviews.title: nice and easy on batteries too
customer_reviews.text: We researched this item for a while and decided to try it. We based our decision on other reviews as well as this product was powered by regular batteries. Very happy with the price of this item and the quality of item. The batteries are lasting a long time. Would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Won't focus.
customer_reviews.text: Could not get it to focus at any distance, so back it goes. Now I have to do more research for a replacement. On a side note, the IR light may as well be a big red flashlight saying here I am. I really like the design, and build quality. I may try another one, and hope I get a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Haddo

customer_reviews.title: I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: im new to the NV scene, this is my first NV device,, but it works perfectly for my needs, also the Price was right and there was a lotta good reviews for it. May upgrade to a gen 2 or 3 later (maybe)..
customer_reviews.author: thomas forshey

customer_reviews.title: Works well for the price.
customer_reviews.text: My first leap into night vision. Have taken it out a few times and worked well, especially for the price. This is old style night vision, so if your expectations align with that, it is a pretty good buy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Hess

customer_reviews.title: Great little monocular for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Great buy for the money. I received mine quickly and put it to use that evening to help stop deer from destroying my tree seedlings. They decimated a new field last year and I could not afford to let that happen again. Picture quality is good and there are no scratches or imperfections on the tube in mine. Focusing takes a minute or two to get the hang of....have to use both adjustments, front and eyepiece. I don't believe there is a better one on the market for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gears

customer_reviews.title: clear low light and IR images
customer_reviews.text: For the price this optic exceeded my expectations. I tried it out just outside my house; max distance was about 175 yards. I thought both the low light and IR images were very sharp. Note, if you don't read the instructions, like me, you may have to monkey around with it awhile to get it right.
customer_reviews.author: RCJL

customer_reviews.title: Basic Night Vision
customer_reviews.text: Very basic Gen1 night vision. Able to make out large objects to about 75 yards. Image is not crisp, so small objects are just visible by shape. This is more of a novelty item.
customer_reviews.author: Dboushie01

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Ok we’ve used this for a while now I’ll just say that my expectations were not high but after close to a year it f use I’d definately buy again. It’s Flir - but it’s good enough for me and my use.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great basic NV, figure out the focus!
customer_reviews.text: Good to go. Basic NV capability at a good price. 2 focal points, objective and eyepiece. Both dialed in give a great, crisp picture. IR flood is also very good. Not something you can use to move with but great for stationary observation.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shadetree Mechanic

customer_reviews.title: Design flaw
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if the one I bought was a lemon or just a design flaw but the battery contacts are too short to complete the circuit. You can hear the batteries rattling around inside. If you press the back part where the batteries are hard you can get it to switch on but that does not seem like a sustainable solution. To be fair when it did work the scope was ok.
customer_reviews.author: JETSETAWAY

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: For the price this thing is way above other products. Again spend 1500 amd nv is on another planet. I can see 200 yards on a full moon and see people.
customer_reviews.author: Stormtrooperhityou

customer_reviews.title: Not what expected AT ALL and RETURN WINDOW VERY SHORT during pandemic.  SHAMEFUL!
customer_reviews.text: Very unhappy we can't return the product. Buyers beware. We bought ahead of time as a present and Dad didn't like it. Although it shows night vision, it isn't clear and quality of picture is poor.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Hibbs

customer_reviews.title: Solid night vision.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for generation one green tinted night vision. Bought for mother to look in fields behind her house at night and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: BG24

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This night vision scope works great. Just make sure you adjust the eyepiece lens before you adjust the big scope lens. It has good range and clear as I would expect it to be. My kids and friends love to play with it and see what's going on at night in my wooded backyard! Definitely a good buy...
customer_reviews.author: Chris De Pierre

customer_reviews.title: Mine Didn't Focus
customer_reviews.text: The light amplification tube seemed to work ok for the money, but I couldn't get it to focus so had to return it. Maybe a different Unit would work, but this was the first item I've ever had to return. I'll try a different one next time.
customer_reviews.author: Robert N

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your time with this one!
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE!! Do not waste your money! Yeah I thought the same thing you did when looking at this.."pretty good price for night vision" well you get what you pay for.. So hard to see anything. Tiny little vision area also! Wish I would have saved my money and got a nicer one!
customer_reviews.author: SHAWN

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness!!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the item used and it works! It's a fixed 5x zoom which I knew before I ordered it. There is a little grainy-ness to it which is to be expected by all gen 1 night vision but all in all its awesome. Read the instructions!!!!
customer_reviews.author: BudgetHunters TV

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: Terrible dont waste your money. If you want night vison a flash light is better or pay and get a 3000 dollar unit.
customer_reviews.author: D. Yang

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: For the money this isn’t bad. You have to play with the adjustments to get a clear picture but it will get there.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Turbyfill

customer_reviews.title: They work better than I expected.
customer_reviews.text: These are pretty cool. Looking forward to using at camp attached to my phone. I was pretty surprised how well you can see in the dark.
customer_reviews.author: Matt  McKay

customer_reviews.title: way better than I was expecting
customer_reviews.text: Given the cost, way better than I was expecting. Very clear focus out to 100 yds, but requires constant adjustment of the objective and ocular. Pretty sure all of the Gen 1 devices are this way, so no biggie. Have had 2 friends purchase the exact same unit after using mine. Thinking about buying another.
customer_reviews.author: Mac R.

customer_reviews.title: You saw a What?
customer_reviews.text: Not the best I've ever seen or used by any stretch of the imagination. It's not a very good sight picture and the quality is very grainy. I don't think you'd be able to tell the difference between a dog and a deer at 60 feet.
customer_reviews.author: MO

customer_reviews.title: Use as remote tester
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted one of these. I use to detect IR devices..like TV remotes, intruder sensors etc.
customer_reviews.author: Carl23

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive for what you get. Vision is blurry.
customer_reviews.text: It’s too expensive do what it does, yes you can look at night but the picture is blurred. I think you can get better one for that money.
customer_reviews.author: Elias

customer_reviews.title: Night vision
customer_reviews.text: get what you pay for. its $100. not a few 1,000 piece. but it does work and is reasonably clear. haven't used out in the woods or fields yet, but should be good. could make out license plats down the road about 70 yards.
customer_reviews.author: Craig

customer_reviews.title: Much better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Much better than expected. The reviews helped in making the decision to buy this model. It was the right choice for our particular purpose, to observe the critters on our property at night. Good valve for the price paid. Yes, it is made in Russia, not China.
customer_reviews.author: M. R.

customer_reviews.title: Way better than expected
customer_reviews.text: For the price, we were surprised at how well this worked. It’s not the best night vision on the market but at this price it exceeded our expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Mom w/2boys

product_meta.title: Firefield Nightfall Night Vision Monocular
product_meta.description: Keep superior nighttime visibility without losing peripheral vision with the Firefield Nightfall 4x50 Night Vision Monocular. Featuring a powerful, built-in PULSE IR illuminator, this high quality device produces a crisp, clear image, perfect for use in hunting, security and general observation situations. The Nightfall 4x50 Monocular is used with one eye only, allowing the other eye to maintain optimal vision. A high resolution intensifier and multi-coated optics ensure a clear, bright image and detailed resolution. Its modern, ergonomic design features a rubber-armored body and lightweight frame, making a perfect addition to any marksmans arsenal. The unit is also water resistant, letting nothing stand in the way of your target.
feature_bullets: High magnification and large objective lens
